intro: Tulipa carinata, commonly known as the ridged tulip, is a species of flowering plant in the genus Tulipa. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its distinctive ridged, elongated petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Tulipa carinata thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its botanical features make it a striking addition to both cultivated gardens and natural landscapes.
